title: Reflection
data:
**Reflection** is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that causes magical [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray") to bounce back from whatever they hit.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Sources](#Sources)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [6.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.4 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [6.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Description

If a ray of any type hits you or a monster with reflection, it will have no effect and be rebounded back in the direction it originated from. Reflection does not protect against [beams](/wiki/Beam "Beam").

Reflection also protects against [floating eyes](/wiki/Floating_eye "Floating eye")' passive paralysis [gaze](/wiki/Gaze "Gaze") and [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")'s [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") gaze: Medusa is also special-cased so that if she can see you or a monster that reflects her gaze, she turns to stone instead.

## Sources

Reflection can be obtained [extrinsically](/wiki/Extrinsic "Extrinsic") from the following items:

- [Amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection")
- [Shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection")
- [Silver dragon scales](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scales "Silver dragon scales") or [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail")
- Wielding [the Longbow of Diana](/wiki/The_Longbow_of_Diana "The Longbow of Diana"), the [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact")
- Wielding [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane")

The item must have the property of reflection, rather than merely being reflective; [crystal plate mail](/wiki/Crystal_plate_mail "Crystal plate mail") and [mirrors](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") cannot grant reflection. The only way to obtain [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") reflection is to [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a [silver dragon](/wiki/Silver_dragon "Silver dragon").

The top level of [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") has a 1⁄2 chance of containing an uncursed amulet of reflection. In the variation of [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") that generates a [titan](/wiki/Titan "Titan"), the statue of Perseus has a 1⁄4 chance of containing a cursed +0 [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), and has a 3⁄4 chance on other maps.

If you have multiple sources of reflection, only one of them will be triggered when a ray hits you. Rays will reflect first from a shield, then from a wielded artifact weapon, then from an amulet, then from body armor, and finally from the silver dragon polymorph form.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

Reflection is a high priority in the early game, and the preferred means of obtaining it are usually an amulet of reflection or silver dragon scale mail (SDSM). Players who get a wish from a [magic lamp](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp") in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") often use it for SDSM (see [GDSM versus SDSM](/wiki/GDSM_versus_SDSM "GDSM versus SDSM")); dragon scale mail does not interfere with spellcasting, making it ideal for roles such as Wizards. A shield of reflection hinders spellcasting and prevents [two-weapon combat](/wiki/Two-weapon_combat "Two-weapon combat") and use of [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") weapons, making it the preferred wish for characters in roles that cannot use or do not seek to use either skill, e.g. a [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman"). While multiple worn sources of reflection are almost always redundant, the order that reflection sources activate in when reflecting rays may become relevant if you are trying to identify the amulet of reflection.

Reflection is especially important for dealing with high-damage wands and [breath weapons](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon"), particularly ones such as the [black dragon](/wiki/Black_dragon "Black dragon")'s breath attack that can result in [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") otherwise - while [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance") also offers protection against black dragon breath specifically, it is very difficult to obtain without killing a black dragon first. Later in the game, reflection's protective uses against rays are somewhat superseded with enough elemental resistances and [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), but remains critical to prevent inventory damage from those rays, especially wands and rings.

## History

Dragonbane's reflection property is added in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1").

## Messages

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"This doesn't list all reflection messages yet."*

- But it reflects from your \<foo>!

  A [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") hitting you was reflected.

- For some reason you are not affected.

  As above, while you are blind.

- But it reflects from \<monster>'s \<foo>!

  A ray hitting a monster was reflected.

- It reflects from your \<foo>!

  A lightning bolt from an [angry god](/wiki/Anger#Smiting "Anger") was reflected.

- For some reason you're unaffected.

  As above, while you are blind.

- \<Monster>'s gaze is reflected by your \<foo>.

  A reflectable [gaze attack](/wiki/Gaze_attack "Gaze attack") against you was reflected.

- Medusa doesn't seem to notice that her gaze was reflected.

  [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")'s reflected gaze attack had no effect because she can't see the reflection.

- The gaze is reflected away by \<its> \<foo>!

  A reflectable gaze attack against a monster was reflected.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[Nighthorn](/wiki/Nighthorn "Nighthorn") grants reflection while wielded.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), reflection only partially deflects damage from reflected rays, with the remaining damage subject to the relevant resistance for that ray's damage type - this also means that reflection does not always prevent inventory damage from rays.

SporkHack also introduces a [spellbook of reflection](/index.php?title=Spellbook_of_reflection\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spellbook of reflection (page does not exist)").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), normal reflection does not reflect the breath weapons of [dragons](/index.php?title=Dragon_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon (dNetHack) (page does not exist)"), as well as those of [half-dragon](/wiki/Half-dragon "Half-dragon") monsters that have an [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") or [monster level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") of at least 14 - the exception is the black dragon, whose breath is a [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration") beam. [Dragon armor](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)") and some artifacts confer "dragonbreath reflection" that additionally reflects these breath weapons, and functions the same as reflection normally does in *NetHack*.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), dragon breath weapons and rays from wands [used at Skilled or higher](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch") ignore most sources of reflection with the exception of [dragon armor](/wiki/Dragon_armor "Dragon armor").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), reflection functions as it does in SporkHack, and the spellbook of reflection is also available. [Reflection](/wiki/Reflection_\(monster_spell\) "Reflection (monster spell)") is also available to monsters as a [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2164](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/muse.c#L2164)

  • Amulet of reflection

  • Wielding the Longbow of Diana, the Ranger quest artifact

Reflection is a high priority in the early game, and the preferred means of obtaining it are usually an amulet of reflection or silver dragon scale mail (SDSM). While multiple worn sources of reflection are almost always redundant, the order that reflection sources activate in when reflecting rays may become relevant if you are trying to identify the amulet of reflection.

Variants

SLASH'EM

Nighthorn grants reflection while wielded.
